title: Rank-Nullity Theorem
contentHtml: The Rank-Nullity Theorem is a fundamental result in Linear Algebra, stating that the rank and nullity of a matrix sum to its dimension.
name: Rank-Nullity Formula" },
statementHtml:
Let \(A \in \mathbb{R}^{m \times n}\) be a matrix with rank \(r\) and nullity \(n\). Prove that \(r + n = m\).

",
hints: Think about the dimension of the kernel
solutionHtml:
We can prove this by showing that the dimension of the column space is equal to the rank, and the dimension of the kernel is equal to the nullity.

  • \(r = \dim(\text{col}(A))\)
  • \(n = \dim(\ker(A))\)
",
problemHtml:
Let \(A = \begin{bmatrix}1 & 2 \\ 3 & 4\end{bmatrix}\). Find the rank and nullity of \(A\), and prove that they sum to 2.

",
steps: [ {"stepNumber": 1, "description": "Find a basis for the column space", "mathHtml": "\[\text{col}(A) = \text{span}\left(\begin{bmatrix}1 \\ 3\end{bmatrix}, \begin{bmatrix}2 \\ 4\end{bmatrix}\right)\]", "explanation": "We can do this by finding the linearly independent columns"}, {"stepNumber": 2, "description": "Find a basis for the kernel", "mathHtml": "\[\ker(A) = \text{span}\left(\begin{bmatrix}-2 \\ 1\end{bmatrix}\right)\]", "explanation": "We can do this by finding the linearly independent vectors in the null space"}, {"stepNumber": 3, "description": "Show that the rank is equal to the dimension of the column space", "mathHtml": "\[r = \dim(\text{col}(A)) = 2\]", "explanation": "This follows from our basis for the column space"}, {"stepNumber": 4, "description": "Show that the nullity is equal to the dimension of the kernel", "mathHtml": "\[n = \dim(\ker(A)) = 1\]", "explanation": "This follows from our basis for the kernel"} ],
finalAnswer: The rank and nullity sum to 2" },
intuition: The Rank-Nullity Theorem helps us understand how matrices can be decomposed into their column space and kernel, which has important implications in machine learning and AI.

title: Rank-Nullity Theorem
contentHtml: The Rank-Nullity Theorem is a fundamental result in Linear Algebra.

problem.statementHtml: Let A be a matrix with rank r and nullity n-r. Prove that the dimension of the column space is equal to the rank.
hints: Hint: Use the fact that the range is spanned by the columns
problem.solutionHtml:
• We know that the range is spanned by the columns, so we can write any vector in the range as a linear combination of the columns.
  • This means that every nonzero column must be independent and contribute to the rank.
  • Conversely, if a column is dependent, it can be written as a linear combination of the other columns, which are already spanned by the first r columns.
  • This shows that the nullity is equal to n-r.
problem.answerShort: The rank is equal to the dimension of the column space
